Comments.Message: Importing an update, will only work if the update has been exported from a Wsus server that use the same Certificate than the importing server.

Which than makes this Feature Kind of useless, don't you think? Would it be possible to Import it into another wsus Server with a different certificate and resign it on Import?

Regards
Norbert

I confirm that, if trying to import a package that have been signed by a Wsus with a different certificate than the importing server, will throw an error.
I can have a look to make WPP to be able to re-sign the package. But I will need to code a module for searching for signature in the package, and for signing the package if need. That can take some time for me to get all documentations.
Note: this can be usefull for Windows Server 2012R2. Because wsus 6.3 seem not able anymore to issue self-signed certificate.

Re-signing the package mean that, I first need to 'Un-Sign' it. Which is not a trivial job.
I think that this feature is interesting, essentially, for Wsus admins who use the same Code-Siging certificate through their organisation.

I will let this feature like this for now.
Why should it be a problem to export an exisiting update without a signature? Or maybe add an option to save the update unsigned AND in the normal way just while the update creation.
